text: The voiceless alveolar stop is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is . The English language has this sound, and it is the sound represented by "t" in tear and tool. == Features == == Examples == Language Word IPA Meaning Adyghe 'five' Arabic Egyptian 'barrette' Assyrian ܒܝܬܐ bèta 'house' Bengali টাকা 'Taka' Czech 'this' Danish Standard 'can' (n.) Dutch 'language' English Most speakers tick 'tick' New York Finnish 'beard' Hebrew 'image' Hungarian 'raft' Kabardian 'five' Khmer / 'tea' Korean / 'bamboo forest' Kurdish Northern 'you' Central 'forehead' Southern Luxembourgish 'thin' Maltese 'true' Mapudungun 'elderly' Nunggubuyu darawa 'greedy' Nuosu Nuosu PortuguesePalatalization in Brazilian Portuguese revisited Some dialects 'thing' (pejorative) Thai ta 'eye' Vietnamese 'flaw' West Frisian 'tooth' ==Notes== ==References== * * * * * * Category:Consonants
title: Voiceless alveolar plosive
